lines.text: I once set out to kill a man. I took pleasure in the thought of his death.
People still drive cattle to rail heads.
If he ain't chicken, he sure has henhouse ways.
The only time to yell is when you're with somebody, or when you're alone.
One look at her makes my teeth itch.
Old Meesa says that lovers come back as coyotes and cry for the love they've lost.
Navajos think it'll be the last sound heard on the earth.
